msbt.message: Hey there, ! Good to see you again so soon.I mean, I was on the same flight as you over here, so it's good to see you so soon again after seeing you Waitthat WAS today that we talked, right? I didn't just sleep the whole time since then?
Hey, it'syou! You made it out to my island! Thanks for comingum ! Whew. It sure is good to see you again, . Yes, sirree Good ol'

Anyway, welcome to Harv's Island!<10_4 /> Don't remember if I mentioned it before, but I run a photo studio here. It's called Photopia, 'cause it's, like, paradise for picture taking, and it's free to all, so come use it anytime!
Oh, hey, it'sahyou! That person I met just today! Whose name is! Glad you came by for a visit! To my studio! Where I also live! How did I miss someone just walking in?
Hey, is that I smell? must be here! I'm sure glad you came to visitbut I WAS a bit surprised. Maybe I should put a bell on the door...?

Eh, it's all good. Welcome to my home AND my photo studio! I call it Photopia, 'cause it's like paradise. It's also totally free for anyone to use, anytime. Mi casaba es su casaba! Is that how that goes? Say, while we're both here, you wanna get a picture? Immortalize the moment a little? Oh, and if you got questions about how to use the studio, I'm always happy to answer!
Tell me more, bud!
Maybe later, man.
What are you waiting for? Head on into the studio!Inside, I'll tell you everything I can remember about studio photography.
Hey, it's ! Nice to see you again. You, uh, still haven't been inside the studio, though Since you already came all this way, you wanna maybe take a tour of the studio this time?
Hey, there! Welcome back to Harv's Island. Or is it technically an archipelago? A Harvipelago?
The studio's open now, so feel free to get in there and take some pictures anytime you like, bud.
Hey, you. What's happening? Any questions about the studio mixed into your mind goulash?
Tell me about sets!
There are models?
Wardrobe?
How do I take pictures?
I'm good!

So, you digging the Photopia vibe? Pretty groovy, right? It's like my home away from home, you know. Wellmore like my home that IS my home, reallyBut hey, since you're here, let's capture the moment on film, huh?And if you've got any questions about the studio, I'm all ears. Well, mostly ears. Some nose too
Tell me more, bud!
Maybe later, man.
I hear ya. No need to rush into anything—my mistakes are here to be learned from! Use my pad whenever.
You sure are, and don't let anybody tell you different!<10_4 /> Welp, feel free to use the studio anytime, bud.
If you're all set, I'm gonna go freshen up my air. Come grab me outside if you need anything.

Really? That's great! OK, you've come to the right dog. Yes, sirree!Alright, there's basically three things to worry about with pictures the set, models, and wardrobe. In other words, arrange your space, gather up the folks you want in the picture, and give 'em costumes. Once you've mastered those three, takin' the actual pictures is easy, at least here in Photopia!
You wanna hear more details about sets, models, wardrobe or, you know, actually taking pictures?
Tell me about sets!
There are models?
Wardrobe?
How do I take pictures?
I'm good!
How'd I do? You need me to explain anything else?
Tell me about sets!
There are models?
Wardrobe?
How do I take pictures?
I'm good!

OK, there's six different rooms here, and you can set each of 'em up however you like. You can press  to change the decor in a studio, just like you do at home.Oh, and speaking of set decorations, I've got a special deal with Nook Shopping So if it's in your catalog, you can just borrow one on the spot to use in your set! Sweet like granola, right?
And if the furniture you want is customizable, you can borrow it in any color!

Oh yeah! That jogs a fun-run of a memory!I guess if you've gone and done Nook Inc.'s customization workshop, you can borrow stuff in other colors! Grapevine says all good things about that workshop, by the way. You might wanna check it out.
Hm Yep! That's everything I know about sets.

Now, nothin' wrong with being your own model if you're feelin' selfie-ish, but you can also invite models! In fact, you can invite up to 10 models if you want to take a group photo! Now, these aren't professional models, mind you. More like neighbors that live on your island. But if you got an Animal Crossing character's amiibo, you can use those to invite other folks! They might not actually be able to come, though. None of them ever show up when I invite them Anyway, you can call others by pressing  and tapping the amiibo to the NFC touchpoint.

Oh, one more thing! You can ask a model in the studio to strike a certain pose if you like. 'Course, you have to be able to show them what you want—like, you gotta model the pose for your model! You can ask 'em to do any pose you can do as a Reaction. So choose a model and do a pose from  .
Hm Yep! That's everything I know about models.

You'll want your models wearing costumes that match the set, right? That's where the wardrobe comes in! Nook Shopping'll lend you clothes just like it does furniture, so you can borrow anything in your catalog. Even better, your models can wear your costumes too, and wardrobe changes are a snap! Just know that, since everybody likes different stuff, some residents won't wear certain things. Anyway, when you're changing sets with , just select a character and press  to switch up their outfit.
Hm Yep! That's everything I know about wardrobe.

You can take pictures with  on your controller or with your NookPhone's  Camera app. Oh, but you can't use your NookPhone when you're changing studio settings with . Drag. All that means is that you have to finish up your settings before you use the  Camera, though. Whether you use  or , you'll find the picture in  on the  HOME Menu.
Oh, and if you're using the  Camera app, you can press   to signal your models that it's time to pose. If you don't know how to request a certain pose, ask me about models!
Hm Yep! That's everything I know about taking pictures.
